name: Old Quarter
culture_adjustments: older Coastal Tongues dialect and conservative social codes
strong guild patronage; apprenticeship precedence over innovation
ancestor-shrine rites woven into commercial contracts and leases
market pidgin concentrated here; multilingual brokers dominate
constraints: limited open land; vertical expansion restricted by heritage guild statutes
ritual services constrained by costly imported reagents
notes: foundational quarter of State_3's port; many charter archives kept here
labyrinthine streets hinder wheeled traffic; goods often transshipped by hand or boat
patronage networks and guild tribunals commonly resolve disputes
